ingredients.item: 2 romano peppers, deseeded and thickly sliced
125g long grain rice, rinsed until the water runs clear (not easy cook)
1½ tbsp Nando’s Medium Peri Peri Sauce
½ x 28g pack coriander or parsley, roughly chopped

instructions.step: Heat the oil in a wide frying pan, then add the peppers and onion, and cook over a high heat for 2 minutes. Add the courgette and cook for 3 minutes more until it starts to soften.

Stir in the turmeric and tomato paste, cook for a few seconds then stir in the rice and stock. Bring to the boil, put the lid on and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring a few times as it cooks to a paella-type consistency, with a little sauce surrounding tender rice. Add a splash more water if needed.

Mix the prawns with the peri peri sauce, then scatter over the rice. Turn the heat down, cover and cook for 4-5 minutes, or until the prawns are pink and opaque and all cooked through. Fork the prawns into the rice, scatter with the herbs to serve.
